caption.center: State of North Dakota, Plaintiff and Appellee v. Nikki Lyn Aipperspach,
a.k.a. Nicole Lyn Aipperspach, Defendant and Appellant.

opinion.posture:
Appeal from the District Court of Cass County, East Central Judicial District, the Honorable RALPH ROBERT ERICKSON, Judge.
AFFIRMED.
opinion.attorneys:
Steven D. Mottinger, Fraase, Johnson, Ramstad Mottinger, 15 South Ninth Street, Fargo, N.D. 58103-1830, for defendant and appellant.
Wade Lykken Webb, Assistant State's Attorney, Cass County Courthouse, P.O. Box 2806, Fargo, N.D. 58108-2806, for plaintiff and appellee.
opinion.opinion_text:
[¶ 1] Nikki Lyn Aipperspach appeals from a judgment of conviction for Abuse of Child in violation of section 14-09-22, N.D.C.C., arguing the trial court erred in denying her pre-trial motion to suppress statements she made to law enforcement officers. We conclude the trial court's decision is based on findings of fact that are supported by sufficient competent evidence and is not contrary to the manifest weight of the evidence. We summarily affirm under N.D.R.App.P. 35.1(a)(2).
[¶ 2] GERALD W. VANDEWALLE, C.J.
MARY MUEHLEN MARING
WILLIAM A. NEUMANN
DALE V. SANDSTROM
CAROL RONNING KAPSNER
